pkgmetadata.longdescription: An XDG Desktop Portal (later called XDP) is a program that lets other applications communicate swiftly with the compositor through D-Bus. It's used for stuff like e.g. opening file pickers, screen sharing. On Wayland, it also requires an implementation. For Hyprland, you'd usually use xdg-desktop-portal-wlr (later called XDPW). Unfortunately, due to various reasons the -wlr portal is inferior to the KDE or Gnome ones. In order to bridge the gap, Hyprland has its own fork of XDPW that has more features, called xdg-desktop-portal-hyprland.
